content: On August 8, 1982, the Atlanta Braves played a crucial game against the Philadelphia Phillies, solidifying their place in the National League East race. The Braves, led by manager Joe Torre, secured a 5-1 victory at Fulton County Stadium, with standout performances from players like Bob Horner, who hit a home run and contributed to the team's momentum as they went on to clinch the division title later that season. This victory was part of a remarkable turnaround for the franchise, as they had finished in last place the previous year.
